qas.question: What is the  transfer of genetic material through a mechanism other than reproduction known as?
In what type of organism is horizontal gene transfer a common source of new genes?
What is one trait that horizontal gene transfer is a common means of spreading?
In what type of organism is horizontal gene transfer rare?
What is one example of horizontal gene transfer in eukaryotes?

answers.text: alga genomes containing genes of bacterial origin

context: <a0_0>Horizontal gene transfer<a0_0/> refers to the transfer of genetic material through a mechanism other than reproduction. This mechanism is a common source of new genes in <a1_0>prokaryotes<a1_0/>, sometimes thought to contribute more to genetic variation than gene duplication. It is a common means of spreading <a2_0>antibiotic resistance<a2_0/>, virulence, and adaptive metabolic functions. Although horizontal gene transfer is rare in <a3_0>eukaryotes<a3_0/>, likely examples have been identified of protist and <a4_0>alga genomes containing genes of bacterial origin<a4_0/>.
